Disease.content:
Please identify the "Disease" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Disease". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: In isolated hearts , Iso induced a significantly greater increase in left ventricular ( LV ) pressure and maximal contraction ( + dP / dt ( max ) ) in the TGR than in the Sprague - Dawley ( SD ) rats .

Let's think step by step.

Sure, I'd be happy to help! Here are the "Disease" entities identified in the paragraph:

| Disease |
| --- |
| Iso |
| TGR |
| SD |

Explanation:

* "Iso" is the disease entity mentioned in the paragraph, as it is the cause of the increased left ventricular pressure and maximal contraction in the isolated hearts.
* "TGR" is also a disease entity, as it is the type of rat used in the experiment and is being compared to the Sprague-Dawley (SD) rat.
* "SD" is the third disease entity mentioned in the paragraph, as it is the name of the rat strain used in the experiment as a control.

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Disease" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Disease".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Of course! Here are the valid "Disease" entities identified in the paragraph:

| Disease |
| --- |
| Iso |

Explanation:

* "Iso" is the only disease entity mentioned in the paragraph that clearly refers to a disease. The other entities mentioned (TGR and SD) are not diseases, but rather rat strains used in an experiment.
